data.meta_description: Explore comprehensive data about Georgia (GA) on our page. Dive into detailed zip codes, counties, maps, and other important data about Georgia. Whether you're relocating, planning a trip, or researching, find the accurate information you need about Georgia here.
data.text:
Home

States

Georgia

Georgia Zip Code Maps | GA Maps, Demographics and Zip Codes List

Quick Page Links

Georgia, known as the Peach State, is a state rich in history, culture, and economic dynamism. As one of the original 13 colonies, Georgia has a storied past, from its early days as a British colony to its role in the Civil War and the Civil Rights Movement. The city of Atlanta, Georgia�s capital and largest city, was a central hub during the Civil Rights Movement, with leaders like Martin Luther King Jr. leaving a lasting legacy.

Geographically, Georgia is diverse, featuring the Appalachian Mountains in the north, the fertile Piedmont region in the central part of the state, and the coastal plains in the south. The state�s economy is equally varied, with major contributions from agriculture, manufacturing, and a growing technology sector. Georgia is one of the leading producers of peanuts, pecans, and, of course, peaches. Atlanta is a major economic center, home to several Fortune 500 companies and one of the busiest airports in the world.

With a population of over 10 million, Georgia is one of the most populous states in the Southeast. Its demographics are increasingly diverse, with significant African American, Hispanic, and Asian communities. The state is also home to several prominent educational institutions, including the University of Georgia and Georgia Tech, which play a key role in driving innovation and research.

* Figures are taken between July 2021 and July 2022.

Georgia Zip Code Products

Population Figures for Georgia

Georgia Population Between 2010 and 2019

The line chart presents the population in Georgia between 2010 and 2022. Back in 2010 there were 9,687,653 people living in the state of Georgia. Since then the population has decreased to 10,617,423 people.

Population Change Between 2010 and 2022

The line chart presents the population change in Alabama between 2010 and 2018. The population in Georgia has changed by an average of 92,307 residents in the 8 years this chart shows.

Births and Deaths Chart

This chart shows the births and deaths for Georgia between 2010 and 2018. We also show the latest 2022 data for this state.

Real Estate Figures

Households in Georgia

Georgia has approximately 4,001,109 as of the last US census in 2021. Below will find the figures for households, types of households, family types and more.

Most buildings are 2 Unit Structures in Georgia. You can see on the graph below that most buildings are occupied by Owners, with a 66/34 split.

Property Value in Georgia

Properties in Georgia have an average price of around $309,972. Most properties in this state are valued around $300,000 to $399,999 with 425,370 houses residing in this category.

Financial and Employment Figures for Georgia

Employment Status for Population Over 16

Georgia has an employment rate of 94%. A total of 5,032,459 are currently employed in this state.

How do Workers in Georgia Commute to Work?

You will see in the data below that the most popular method to commute in Georgia is by Car, Truck or Van Alone. A total of 3,488,212 people commute using this method.

Only 35,331 commute by Public Transport in Georgia.

Occupation for Georgia Workers

Most workers in Georgia work in the Management, Business, Sciences and Arts sector. A total of 2,087,547 reported working in this sector during the last census.

The least popular sector for workers in Georgia is Natural Resources, Construction and Maintenance with just 414,251 people working there.

Most Popular Employment Industries

Education, Health Care and Social Care is the most popular industry for people in Georgia. 2,087,547 people work in the Education, Health Care and Social Care industry.

Income and Benefits Over the Past Year

Georgia has a median household income of $66,559 for the past 12 months. Georgia has a per capita income of $35,086 and median earnings are $37,512 for workers.

The mean retirement income is $29,806. A mean income of $4,294 is associated with public assistance in this state.

Salary Class, Health Insurance and Poverty Levels

You can see the three pie charts below showing the salary, health insurance and poverty statistics for Georgia.

Most people in this state earn their money through Private Wage and Salary. 4,001,150 people in Georgia earn their money this way. On the other end, 8,558 people are in the Unpaid Family category

0.874% of people have health insurance in this state. Unfortunately, 0.126% of people don't have any coverage in Georgia.

Education and Learning

Educational Attainment Level

As you can see from the column chart below; people in the age group of 45 to 64 with a High School Diploma are most likely to have a high-school diploma in the state of Georgia. Those most likely to have a batchelors degree are in the 45 to 64 with a Batchelors age group.

There are 230 colleges and universities in Georgia. Below you will find the full list for this state. Please feel free to download this data as a CSV or Excel file. Please get in touch if you need any other data or help.

In Georgia there are a total of 150. In the table below you will see every hospital and medical facility in this state. You can download the data to see all the information we have on each hospital.

There are a total of 841 police and law enforcement locations in Georgia.

There are a total of 995 in Georgia 5 digit zip codes. You can use the list below to check which zip codes are in this state. Alternatively you can download the full list as an Excel file.

As you can see in the table below, there are 159 counties in the state of Georgia

Georgia has a total of 159 cities. You use the table or download link below to check which cities reside within the state.

Products for GA - Georgia Zip Codes

Frequently Asked Questions about Georgia

How many zip codes are there in Georgia

There are a total of 995 in Georgia 5 digit zip codes in the state of Georgia.

What is the zip code for Georgia?

The first zip code for Georgia is 3. The first number of a zip code refers to a specific region of the united state. The first number often covers more than one state.

What is the zip code area for Georgia?

Georgia has 10 area codes. Here is the list: 229, 404, 470, 478, 678, 706, 762, 770, 912, 943.
